title: 14-year-old boy killed in drive-by shooting
content:
LOUISVILLE, KY (WAVE) - Police say that the death of a 14-year-old boy Wednesday night was the result of a drive-by shooting in a neighborhood known for its drug activity.
Troyvonte Hurt, 14, died of a single gunshot wound to the head in the Smoketown neighborhood - near the intersection of Clay and Jacob streets - Wednesday.

Thursday, Louisville Metro Police Department Lt. Todd Kessinger described the shooting as a drive-by in an area that is a "well-known drug area" and said that police found drugs on the ground at the scene.
A 16-year-old and a 24-year-old also suffered gunshot wounds, but both were non-life-threatening injuries.
"I think there were a lot of people that were’ extremely lucky,” Kessinger said. “We were extremely lucky we only had three victims.”
Kessinger estimated there were between 15 and 20 people at the street corner when the shooting occurred, but added that despite a large crowd of witnesses police have received little information.
“It’s a situation where a 14-year-old gets killed in front of 20 people and when the police get there, nobody saw or heard anything,” Kessinger said.
However he added that police have receiving some information from the LMPD's Anonymous Tip Line.
Kessinger said that the LMPD has a description of the vehicle involved in the shooting, but not enough to share with the public yet.
Anyone with info on the shooting is urged to call the LMPD Anonymous Tip Line at 574-LMPD.
